H3.text: when did ford change the f150 body style. 1957

A4.text: For the 2004 model year, the F-150 was redesigned on an all-new platform.

A5.text: The long-running Flareside bed design was retired until its return in the 1992 ninth-generation, with all examples produced with Styleside beds.

A6.text: For the 2004 model year, the F-150 was redesigned on an all-new platform, which has a fully boxed-in frame and introduced rear shocks to mount outside of the frame for decreased wheel hop and improved ride quality.

A7.text: Since 1967, the cab design has changed only in 1980 and in 2000.
